name: Sinking Paradise
title: Most Vulnerable to Rising Sea Levels
description: In 2015, 81.7% of the Marshall Islands' land area was below 5 meters in elevation, making it one of the most susceptible nations to rising sea levels.

name: Food First
title: Dominance of Food Manufacturing
description: In 2021, food, beverages, and tobacco accounted for 98.1% of the value added in manufacturing, highlighting the sector's overwhelming importance to the economy.

name: Health Aid Dependency
title: High External Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, the Marshall Islands had an external health expenditure per capita of $455.51, indicating a significant reliance on international health funding.

name: Tuberculosis Challenge
title: High Tuberculosis Incidence
description: In 2023, the incidence of tuberculosis was 692 cases per 100,000 people, posing a significant public health challenge.

name: Social Safety Net for the Wealthy
title: Social Insurance Coverage for the Rich
description: In 2019, 66.2% of the richest quintile in the Marshall Islands were covered by social insurance programs, indicating a focus on wealthier citizens.

name: Debt-Free Dream
title: Lowest Central Government Debt
description: In 2019, the Marshall Islands had one of the lowest central government debts globally, amounting to just 96,801,972 LCU. This reflects a strong fiscal position and prudent financial management.

name: Eco-Friendly Champs
title: Minimal Nitrous Oxide Emissions
description: The Marshall Islands emitted a mere 0.0002 Mt CO2e of nitrous oxide in 2023, showcasing its commitment to maintaining a low environmental footprint.

name: Modest Consumption
title: Low Household Consumption Expenditure
description: In 2023, household consumption expenditure in the Marshall Islands was 183,222,100 US$, indicating a modest level of consumer spending compared to global standards.

name: Service Sector Reliance
title: High Service Value Added
description: The service sector contributed significantly to the economy with a value of 182,726,900 LCU in 2023, highlighting the country's reliance on services over manufacturing.

name: Limited Manufacturing
title: Minimal Manufacturing Contribution
description: In 2021, other manufacturing accounted for only 1.89% of the value added in manufacturing, indicating a limited industrial base.

name: Educational Progress
title: Few Girls Out of School
description: By 2022, only 15 primary school-aged girls were out of school, reflecting significant progress in female education.

name: Small Export Economy
title: Minimal Commercial Service Exports
description: In 2021, the Marshall Islands exported commercial services worth just 1,059,451 US$, indicating a small export economy.
